articles.author: Ankika Biswas, Shashwat Chauhan
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes slid more than 1% on Tuesday after a hotter-than-expected jobs report deepened worries over interest rates staying higher for longer, providing a fresh leg up to Treasury yields and dragging megacap stocks lower.
articles.title: Wall St dives as jobs data fans rate worries, Treasury yields spike

articles.author: Yoruk Bahceli, Karin Strohecker, Dhara Ranasinghe
articles.description: The world's biggest bond markets are in the throes of another rout as a new era of higher for longer interest rates takes hold.
articles.title: Why a rout in government bonds is worrying

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: U.S. job openings unexpectedly increased in August amid a surge in demand for workers in the professional and business services sector, pointing to a still-tight labor market that could compel the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates next month.
articles.title: US job openings jump in August; quits rate unchanged

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: Two U.S. senators said they were investigating short video sharing app TikTok's reported decision recently to hire several high-level executives from its Chinese parent company, ByteDance.
articles.title: US senators examine TikTok hiring of ByteDance executives

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: General Motors Co's (GM.N) third-quarter U.S. auto sales jumped about 21%, the company said on Tuesday, fueled by improved supply and sustained demand for its SUVs and pickup trucks.
articles.title: GM third-quarter US sales surge 21% on resilient demand for SUVs, pickups

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of instances of greenwashing by banks and financial services companies around the world rose 70% in the past 12 months from the previous 12 months, a report on Tuesday showed.
articles.title: Banks behind 70% jump in greenwashing incidents in 2023 -report

articles.author: Brendan Pierson
articles.description: A New Jersey appeals court on Tuesday threw out a $223.8 million verdict against Johnson & Johnson (JNJ.N) in a trial over four plaintiffs' claims that they developed cancer from being exposed to the company's talc powder products.
articles.title: Court tosses $223.8 million verdict against J&J in talc cancer case

articles.author: David Morgan, Moira Warburton
articles.description: Allies of embattled U.S. House Speaker Kevin McCarthy on Tuesday moved to block a challenge to his leadership by a fellow Republican, plunging the chamber into an intra-party dispute that could tip Congress into chaos.
articles.title: McCarthy sets up US House vote on challenge to his leadership

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: By Polina Nikolskaya and Maria Tsvetkova
articles.title: Insight: 'They're just meat': Russia deploys punishment battalions in echo of Stalin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada wants private talks with India to resolve a diplomatic dispute over the murder of a Sikh separatist leader, Foreign Minister Melanie Joly said on Tuesday, after a report said India had asked the country to withdraw 41 diplomats.
articles.title: Canada wants private talks with India to resolve diplomatic spat
